hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac68}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into eight equal parts. Each part is labeled one eighth. Six parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into three equal parts. Each part is labeled one third. Two parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-eighths to eight-eighths and tick marks below the number line from zero-thirds to three-thirds. A blue point appears at the tick mark six-eighths. A green point appears at the tick mark two-thirds. The green point is to the left of the blue point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. Both rectangles show one whole divided into eight equal parts. The top rectangle has six parts shaded. The bottom rectangle has seven parts shaded. A number line below the rectangle shows tick marks from zero-eighths to eight-eighths. A blue point appears at the tick mark six-eighths. A purple point appears at the tick mark seven-eighths. The purple point is to the right of the blue point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into eight equal parts. Six parts are shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into four equal parts. Three parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangle shows tick marks above the number line from zero-eighths to eight-eighths and tick marks below the number line from zero-fourths to four-fourths. A pink point and blue point appear at the same tick mark labeled six-eighths and three-fourths. !

hints.content: $\maroonD{L}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac68}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac68$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has, moving from left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark with a point labeled L, and a tick mark at 1. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{6}{8}$? **

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A number line that has, moving from left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark with a point labeled L, and a tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ad6ea09de5224afd9e9988e1cf3b81e9579b69be)

![A number line that has, moving from left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, one unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark with a point labeled M, and a tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/58fee129483fad0c93d003fc8d429f44c9c4ad3f)

![A number line that has, moving from left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, six unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark with a point labeled N, and a tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2a2984bfd95ed85bcf7032b2b5838164510bf120)
